conclusion: Use principles of conservation of momentum and kinematics to determine exit velocity of bullet.
Before collision, bullet has velocity v_b and ping-pong ball is at rest.
After collision, bullet and ping-pong ball move together with common velocity v.
Conservation of momentum gives m v_b = (m + M) v.
Solve for v: v = m v_b / (m + M).
Ping-pong ball and bullet combination falls from height h and travels horizontal distance s.
Time t to fall from height h can be found using free fall equation h = 1/2 g t^2.
Horizontal distance s is given by s = v t.
Substitute v and t: s = (m v_b / (m + M)) sqrt(2h/g).
Rearrange equation to solve for v_b: v_b = s (m + M) / m sqrt(g/2h).
Exit velocity of bullet v_b can be expressed as v_b = s (m + M) / m sqrt(g/2h).
